answers.answer: I would worry to much. How was your B/P? How is your water intake? You may have only had a very small amount...

i had it when i was 35 weeks. i had preeclampsia and had to deliver my daughter via c-sec as soon as it was confirmed by 24 hr urine sample. watch your bp, and you may want to request that they do a 24 hour test. i think a certain amount is OK, which is why they make you do the 24 hour sample if they suspect a problem. It's a slight pain- you have to keep a gigantic jug with your pee in it in your fridge.

Thanks for the responses.  I haven't had much water today at all and my b/p was 120/80.  I guess I really need to push the water and see if that helps.  Just makes me nervous.tiredbuthappy-LOL!  Okay, you have to elaborate on the jug of pee..!!  I had to read your post 3 times b/c I just knew it was a typo on your part and you meant to type water..LOL!!
A 24 hour urine sample means you have to collect your urine for 24 hours, which is why you would have a jug of urine in the fridge.

question: Hi guys...just got back from my OB appt and I have protein in my urine.  Dr and nurse didn't seem overly concerned but I thought this was a sign of pre-eclampsia (sp???)??  I never had this w/ my other pregnancies so this is new to me.  Any ideas??
title: 17W Pregnant and Protein in Urine??
